channel.title: Power Apps on Microsoft 365 Community Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Power Apps on Microsoft 365 Community Blog

item.title: Power Platform Community Call – April 2022
item.description: Two demos: Customer Inventory and Daily Expenses App and Introduction to Power Apps Portals. Changes to Community and call structure, Power Platform Community events, recent news – five items. Register for Power Platform Samples – First Time Contributor May 9th.

item.title: Migrate Cloud Flows and Canvas Apps across tenants
item.description: Introduction If you are a Power App or Power Automate developer, chances are you had to move your creations between SharePoint sites or even Microsoft 365 tenants.

item.title: How to create a custom connector for your own Azure hosted API
item.description: In this blog post I am going to cover: How to create an API with JavaScript, How to deploy this to Azure, How to wrap the API into a custom connector, How to use the connector in Power Apps

item.title: Power Apps Community Call – February 2022
item.description: Topics covered in this month’s community call includes 2 demos: Make your wishes come true with Power Apps (Good Deeds App - 3 Lists, 3 E-mail addresses and 2 Flows) - Pranav Khurana and Spice up your Power Apps with SVGs (options - ranging from static to interactive - for adding SVG graphics with little code to your Power Apps) - Robin Rosengrün (EnBW). Recent Power Apps News and Community Contributions (Power Apps and Power Apps Portals code releases and new Dataverse auditing features) – Todd Baginski (Canviz). ACTION: Please vote on What to call this call? This call was hosted by Todd Baginski (Canviz). The call was recorded on February 16, 2022. Questions addressed in chat throughout the call.

item.title: Power Apps Community Call – January 2022
item.description: Topics covered in this month’s community call includes 2 demos: Power Audio Player (Canvas app, modified audio control functionality, SharePoint list back-end) - Shadrack Inusah (DreamOval) and New Pay as you go Features (Public Preview - Power Apps Premium environments with Azure subscription) - Kavishi Agarwal (Microsoft), Recent Power Apps News and Community Contributions (Power Platform ALM Accelerator, Power Apps portals and Power Apps Ideas) – Todd Baginski (Canviz) and learn about 5 new PnP Power Apps Samples – April Dunnam (Microsoft). This call included the first ever Power Apps Community Call Quiz – using a Power App and played during the live call. This call was hosted by Todd Baginski (Canviz). The call was recorded on January 19, 2022. Questions addressed in chat throughout the call.

item.title: Working with APIs in Power Platform for beginners
item.description: I recently learned how to work with APIs and the different methods to call them.

item.title: Microsoft 365 self-service using Power Apps
item.description: Many organizations are moving towards a modern workplace. And most of the time, that does not happen overnight.

item.title: Matching the logged in user in a canvas app with a person column in SharePoint
item.description: Recently, I came across an interesting issue using people columns in a SharePoint list.

item.title: How 3 makers, 2 devs and a princess came together to save kittens for a hackathon
item.description: The Story (Michael) Just before Southcoast Summit 2021 got started, the organizers hosted the Automate Everything - SS2021 Hackathon where every solution revolves around Flic buttons.

item.title: Running a Power App as Edge Extension
item.description: To get started you do need a sample, the demo used to get you started is a solution to capture interesting pages in your browser to read later.

item.title: ProvisionGenie - an open-source provisioning engine for Microsoft Teams
item.description: Once upon a time I teamed up with my friend and partner in crime Carmen Ysewijn.

item.title: Microsoft Power Apps Community Call -- September 2021
item.description: Call summary Topics covered in this month’s community call include demos in Visio, Power BI Tiles, and Reports in Power Apps!

item.title: Source code editing for Canvas Apps
item.description: Why? Ever since I saw the post Source code files for Canvas apps from Microsoft, I thought this might come in handy for some of my Canvas Apps.

item.title: Let's build a timer app for teams meetings
item.description: Introduction Wouldn’t it be nice to have a timer at meetings, so that everybody can see how much time has passed and how much is remaining?

item.title: How to get Source Code files for Power Apps Canvas apps
item.description: This post will guide you through the process of how to use the Power Apps Language Toolkit to extract a Power Apps .

item.title: Power Apps: source code edit for Canvas Apps in Visual Studio Code
item.description: Why? In April, I showed how to unpack and repack Power Apps .

item.title: What I (as a non dev) learned as I created my first Power App
item.description: I like to share my very own experiences while building my first canvas app.

item.title: Learn to debug your Power Apps
item.description: Make troubleshooting and understanding single elements easier They exist. Those little moments that drive you crazy.

item.title: Export Power Apps and Power Automate user licenses
item.description: Context During a Power Platform audit for a customer, I was looking for exporting all user licenses data into a single file to analyze it with Power BI.

item.title: How to beautify your Power Apps
item.description: Power Apps offers you a variety of icons - and recently, there were nice additions announced and rolled out.

item.title: 10 things we should think about before we build an app
item.description: With Power Apps, we can rapidly build custom business applications that connect to our business data in a low code manner.

item.title: Fully leverage the possibilities of the dev tenant
item.description: Now let’s imagine this. You have the developer tenant from your Microsoft 365 Developer Subscription, and you enrolled the Power Apps Community Plan with it, so you have the full range of possibilities on your dev tenant, right?

item.title: How to enhance your "dev tenant" to unleash the full potential of the Power Platform
item.description: The Microsoft 365 Developer tenant is an amazing feature to learn and experiment in the Microsoft 365 universe (actually I’m talking about your personal development “sandbox” of the Microsoft 365 developer program.
